OOC: Tucson collapsed due to extreme exhaustion and some moderate burn dama=
ges from the magma. Yes, even magma didn't stopp him from trying to help hi=
s comrades.  He's got some burn marks in his armor, and that's his damaged =
state for now.

BIC: 

Perhaps the power he had extended outward, was in va=
in.  Tucson lies on the ground for a moment or so, but slowly rolls back up=
 onto his left side, holding up his upper body with his arms which shake un=
der the sheer pressure of his weight.  He looks around, and finds Darkhawk,=
 severely weakened by the powerful blast.  Night Shift wastes no time in sl=
apping a pair of stasis cuffs on Darkhawk, who in reality was Windlord.

"G=
otchya.  Don't worry, you're in good hands now. Yo, Kup!  Better take this =
guy for me, I think Tucson Prime's commn' around."

Tucson calmly looks aro=
und yet with a stern expression on his face.

"Not - the result I was hopin=
g for but - it did enable us to get somewhere.  Can't - have it all I suppo=
se, but doesn't mean we're giving up all together."

Slowly he makes it ont=
o his knees, and then plants one foot down on the ground, hoisting himself =
up to his feet, with a bit of a stumble. He was weak, extremely weak, and i=
t was questionable wether or not he would be able to continue fighting.  He=
 didn't want anyone to see him in such a condition though.  He fights his w=
eakness and tries to shrug off the grogginess he feels.  Night Shift nodds =
in agreement with Tucson Prime.  

" I hear ya on that one big bot.  Someti=
mes, ya win some, ya lose some, and sometimes it's kinda like in the middle=
 of both losn' and winn'n."

Tucson understood that the mission itself woul=
d be difficult so he prepared himself for the unexpected by working with th=
at uncertainty that plans don't always go as they are intended.  He shrugs =
off the fact that Cyclonus is not even scathed by the energy attack.  He wa=
s now curious about Rodimus and how he had handled it.  

" Something - Rod=
imus wasn't too good at doing.  I have a feeling he may not have taken this=
 too well, Nightshift."

Nightshift narrows his optics.

" Lemme tell ya so=
methn' Tucson, before you became a Prime, and he was on the job, it didn't =
look like his spark was totally in his work. But you, the quiet guy in the =
corner, the guy who threw caution ta the wind ta save his comrades, the guy=
 who faces  adversity as it comes and ain't afraid of it, and the guy who a=
ctually learned from his loss rather than complain'n about it.  You got wha=
t it takes, and always had it.  It - just wasn't obvious because you're too=
 modest for your own good and you kinda just kept ta yourself most of the t=
ime."

Tucson listens thoughtfully to Nightshift.

" You're right, I wasn't=
 much for words at the time...  But back then, I wanted to approach Rodimus=
 on his not so pleasurable attitude on his position as a Prime.  It seemed =
as if he didn't want it.  And you know, responsibility isn't for everyone. =
 And for some, it's second nature."

Night Shift nodds.

" Understandable. =
 Now I admit, I dunno if I could ever take your job big guy.  Not that I ai=
n't capable of it, I know I ain't a good match for the position.  And I ain=
't afraid ta admit that."

Tucson Prime nodds once, and studies Cyclonus on=
ce more.  Something dawns on him.  He seemed relieved to be free of somethi=
ng.  

"Is it me Cyclonus or do you appear to be liberated of something tha=
t may have been holding you back?  Why do you work with Hydras anyway? What=
 is the purpose of working with him when you can be your own individual?  Y=
our life should be as you intended, and not what others have intended for y=
ou.  It boils down to freedom.  You have the chance to experience freedom. =
 If I were you I'd take that chance now.  As a matter of fact, Scorponok, S=
courge, what seems to be holding you two back here, when you yourselves can=
 be your own individuals as Decepticons?  Does Hydras have you on some sort=
 of leash?  I see no such restraints so that means if you want freedom you =
should also take it."

Night Shift could see what Tucson was up to.  It was=
 one of his thinking outside the box kind of strategies. And a strategy tha=
t would benefit all and not just one faction.  Tucson was trying to break n=
ew ground, and as crazy as it all looked, he sits back to watch it all take=
 place.  Tucson Prime now steps asside and waits to see if any of them eith=
er try to destroy him, or actually agree with what he was trying to tell th=
em.

"Whatever any of you chose, your decision is your own and I will not i=
nterfere.  We may not be allies, but I do respect the need for one's free w=
ill.  But if you attack me, do not expect me to be so forgiving."



--- In=
 nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

ightlight Nodded, she stood up with fear in her face. she was ready to foll=
ow Rodimus
> 
> Rodimus tapped his code on the door and it slid open. He st=
epped out
> of the chamber and looked around for a moment. He nodded, satis=
fied
> that there were no intruders in the hall. He looked back at Nightlig=
ht
> and motioned for her to follow.
> 
> With a grinding of gears he shift=
ed into his vehicular mode and opened his door.
> 
> "Come on." he said as =
he gunned his engine. "I will will protect you.
> We need to head towards t=
he throne room. If there is anywhere that is
> more protected in this place=
 it is there."
> 
> He flipped on his lights and once Nightlight had gotten=
 in he took
> off, burning rubber as he moved!

and Nightlight should be unaware of Tuscon's

e a good way to bring everyone together.
